intro: Indigofera hochstetteri subsp. streyana, commonly known as the red-stemmed indigo. It is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa, characterized by its distinctive red stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale blue or white, arranged in dense clusters. It is part of the legume family, Fabaceae, and has the ability to fix nitrogen through its root nodules. This subspecies is often found in moist, shady habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
